<!-- annex content -->
<h2 id="m4-code-generation-examples"><a href="#m4-code-generation-examples" title="⚓">A</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;Code generation examples&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-code-generation-examples" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h2>
<div class="rs-tip-major m4-tip">Chars. {<code>`'</code>, <code>[]</code>, <strong><code>␂␆</code></strong>, <code>〖〗</code>} in the name controls the <a href="#m4-nonterminal-expansion-control" title="Nonterminal expansion control">expansion of nonterminals</a>.</div>
<p id="m4-toc-input-source-code" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-input-source-code">A.1&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Input source code</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-csv-simplest-example" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-csv-simplest-example">A.2&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> CSV – simplest example</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-csv-counter" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-csv-counter">A.3&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> CSV – counter</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-modification-of-special-characte" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-modification-of-special-characte">A.4&nbsp;&nbsp;<code title="how to do it">&#x1f4a1;</code> Modification of special characters</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-c-output-queue" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-c-output-queue">A.5&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> C – output queue</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-ini-an-external-command" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-ini-an-external-command">A.6&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> INI – an external command</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-h-hex-counter" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-h-hex-counter">A.7&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> .h – hex counter</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-c-small-automaton" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-c-small-automaton">A.8&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> C – small automaton</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-c-small-automaton-2" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-c-small-automaton-2">A.9&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> C – small automaton 2</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-html-output-queues" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-html-output-queues">A.10&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> HTML – output queues</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-branching-by-grammar" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-branching-by-grammar">A.11&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Branching by grammar</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-json-generating-automaton" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-json-generating-automaton">A.12&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – generating automaton</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-json-named-queues" class="m4-level3"><a href="#m4-json-named-queues">A.12.1&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – named queues</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-json-generated-queue-indexes" class="m4-level3"><a href="#m4-json-generated-queue-indexes">A.12.2&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – generated queue indexes</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-ini-discontinuous-queue-index" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-ini-discontinuous-queue-index">A.13&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> INI – discontinuous queue index</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-xml-mixed-messages" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-xml-mixed-messages">A.14&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> XML – mixed messages</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-xml-separated-messages" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-xml-separated-messages">A.15&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> XML – separated messages</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-bash-cmd-echo-dstringd" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-bash-cmd-echo-dstringd">A.16&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash <code>~]$ echo "string"</code></a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-bash-cmd-echo-astringa" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-bash-cmd-echo-astringa">A.17&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash <code>~]$ echo 'string'</code></a></p>
<div class="rs-tip-major m4-tip">The examples in this annex are more complex and are intended to demonstrate the practical use of M4.
They will be explained in more detail later.</div>
<h3 id="m4-input-source-code"><a href="#m4-input-source-code" title="⚓">A.1</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Input source code&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-input-source-code" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The input source code is similar to <abbr title="Comma Separated Values">CSV</abbr>, which is converted to arbitrarily complex target code of another language using <abbr title="Context-Free Grammar">CFG</abbr>, automata and output queues.
Stacks in the examples are not used.</p>
<p><code><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages_raw.mc" title="GitHub">messages_raw.mc</a></code> – the input source code contains special characters ⚠</p>
<pre title="messages_raw.mc"># 2018/05/15 Josef Kubin

ERROR([COMPLEX],     [!"#$%&amp;'()*+ ,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~])
QUERY([READABLE],    [Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?])
ERROR([SUCCESS],     [Complex M4 code failed successfully.])
WARNING([ADDICTIVE], [Programming in M4 is addictive!])
ERROR([NOFAULT],     [It's not a language fault!])
WARNING([NO_ERRORS], [No other errors detected.])</pre>
<div class="rs-tip-major m4-tip">The input file may also contain notes that may not be hidden in the comments <code>#</code>, <code>dnl</code>, <code>ifelse([…])</code> or <code>[… somewhere inside brackets …]</code>.</div>
<h3 id="m4-csv-simplest-example"><a href="#m4-csv-simplest-example" title="⚓">A.2</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> CSV – simplest example&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-csv-simplest-example" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>This example does not use output queues, it only generates <abbr title="Comma Separated Values">CSV</abbr> separated by <code>TAB</code>.</p>
<pre title="hello.csv.m4"># A → β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
[$1]	$2
divert(-1)
])</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/hello.csv.m4" title="GitHub">hello.csv.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages_raw.mc" title="GitHub">messages_raw.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/hello.csv" title="GitHub">hello.csv</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 hello.csv.m4 messages_raw.mc &gt; hello.csv</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="hello.csv">COMPLEX	!"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~
SUCCESS	Complex M4 code failed successfully.
NOFAULT	It's not a language fault!</pre>
<h3 id="m4-csv-counter"><a href="#m4-csv-counter" title="⚓">A.3</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> CSV – counter&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-csv-counter" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses the <code>COUNT_UP</code> macro from the root file whose <abbr title="the right side of the rewriting rule"><code>β</code></abbr> is copied to the right side of the <code>COUNTER</code> macro.
During the first expansion of <code>COUNTER</code> its initial value is initialized.
Further expansion returns the numeric terminal symbol and increases the auxiliary (global) symbol by one.
<code>COUNTER</code> is a&nbsp;small automaton.</p>
<pre title="counter.csv.m4"># A → β
define([COUNTER], defn([COUNT_UP]))

# init counter
COUNTER(1)

# A → β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
ERR_[]COUNTER	[$1]	$2
divert(-1)
])</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/counter.csv.m4" title="GitHub">counter.csv.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages_raw.mc" title="GitHub">messages_raw.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/counter.csv" title="GitHub">counter.csv</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 counter.csv.m4 messages_raw.mc &gt; counter.csv</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="counter.csv">ERR_1	COMPLEX	!"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~
ERR_2	SUCCESS	Complex M4 code failed successfully.
ERR_3	NOFAULT	It's not a language fault!</pre>
<h3 id="m4-modification-of-special-characte"><a href="#m4-modification-of-special-characte" title="⚓">A.4</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code title="how to do it">&#x1f4a1;</code> Modification of special characters&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-modification-of-special-characte" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>Each type of output code requires the modification of the special characters.
The M4 <code>patsubst()</code> keyword is inappropriate for this type of task.
First, we hide all special characters of the input file into appropriately named macros using regular expressions.</p>
<h4 id="m4-modified-input-code"><a href="#m4-modified-input-code" title="⚓">»</a>&nbsp;Modified input code</h4>
<p><code><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></code> – all special characters are hidden into macros</p>
<pre title="messages.mc"># 2018/05/15 Josef Kubin

ERROR([COMPLEX],     [[]EX()[]DQ()[#]$%[]AMP()[]AP()()*+[,]-./:;[]LT()=[]GT()?@[]LB()[]BS()[]RB()^_[]BQ(){|}~])
QUERY([READABLE],    [Is badly written M4 code readable []LB()N/y[]RB()?])
ERROR([SUCCESS],     [Complex M4 code failed successfully.])
WARNING([ADDICTIVE], [Programming in M4 is addictive[]EX()])
ERROR([NOFAULT],     [It[]AP()s not a language fault[]EX()])
WARNING([NO_ERRORS], [No other errors detected.])</pre>
<p>We create several conversion files according to the target code type, <code>LB()</code> and <code>RB()</code> macros for square brackets are already defined in the root file:</p>
<h4 id="m4-xml-xslt-html"><a href="#m4-xml-xslt-html" title="⚓">»</a>&nbsp;<code>[]</code> XML, XSLT, HTML</h4>
<p><code><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/markup.m4" title="GitHub">markup.m4</a></code> – conversion file for markup languages</p>
<pre title="markup.m4"># A → β
define([AMP], [&amp;amp;])
define([AP], ['])
define([BQ], [`])
define([BS], [\])
define([DQ], ["])
define([EX], [!])
define([GT], [&amp;gt;])
define([LT], [&amp;lt;])</pre>
<h4 id="m4-c-json-ini-dstringd"><a href="#m4-c-json-ini-dstringd" title="⚓">»</a>&nbsp;<code>[]</code> C, JSON, INI – <code>"string"</code></h4>
<p><code><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a></code> – conversion file for a source code</p>
<pre title="code.m4"># A → β
define([AMP], [&amp;])
define([AP], ['])
define([BQ], [`])
define([BS], [\\])
define([DQ], [\"])
define([EX], [!])
define([GT], [&gt;])
define([LT], [&lt;])</pre>
<h4 id="m4-bash-dstringd"><a href="#m4-bash-dstringd" title="⚓">»</a>&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash – <code>"string"</code></h4>
<p><code><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/doubleq.m4" title="GitHub">doubleq.m4</a></code> – conversion file for Bash strings in quotation marks</p>
<pre title="doubleq.m4"># A → β
define([AMP], [&amp;])
define([AP], ['])
define([BQ], [\`])
define([BS], [\\])
define([DQ], [\"])
define([EX], ["\!"])
define([GT], [&gt;])
define([LT], [&lt;])</pre>
<h4 id="m4-bash-astringa"><a href="#m4-bash-astringa" title="⚓">»</a>&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash – <code>'string'</code></h4>
<p><code><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/apost.m4" title="GitHub">apost.m4</a></code> – conversion file for Bash strings in apostrophes</p>
<pre title="apost.m4"># A → β
define([AMP], [&amp;])
define([AP], ['\''])
define([BQ], [`])
define([BS], [\])
define([DQ], ["])
define([EX], [!])
define([GT], [&gt;])
define([LT], [&lt;])</pre>
<h4 id="m4-csv-m4"><a href="#m4-csv-m4" title="⚓">»</a>&nbsp;<code>[]</code> CSV, M4</h4>
<p><code><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/unchanged.m4" title="GitHub">unchanged.m4</a></code> – the conversion file puts all special characters back</p>
<pre title="unchanged.m4"># A → β
define([AMP], [&amp;])
define([AP], ['])
define([BQ], [`])
define([BS], [\])
define([DQ], ["])
define([EX], [!])
define([GT], [&gt;])
define([LT], [&lt;])</pre>
<h3 id="m4-c-output-queue"><a href="#m4-c-output-queue" title="⚓">A.5</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> C – output queue&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-c-output-queue" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses one output queue for characters <code>};</code> to close the array at the end.</p>
<pre title="array.c.m4"># A → β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
	"$2",
divert(-1)
])

divert(0)dnl
/*
 * DONTE()
 */

char *error[[]] = {
divert(1)dnl
};
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/array.c.m4" title="GitHub">array.c.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/array.c" title="GitHub">array.c</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 array.c.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; array.c</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="array.c">/*
 * DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!
 */

char *error[] = {
	"!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~",
	"Complex M4 code failed successfully.",
	"It's not a language fault!",
};</pre>
<h3 id="m4-ini-an-external-command"><a href="#m4-ini-an-external-command" title="⚓">A.6</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> INI – an external command&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-ini-an-external-command" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example runs an external <code>date</code> command and places its output in square brackets.
The output of an external command are two comma-separated items.
The <code>FST()</code> macro selects the first item because the second item contains an unwanted <code>LF</code> (<samp>0x0a</samp>) new line character.</p>
<pre title="hello.ini.m4"># A → β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
[$1]="$2"
divert(-1)
])

divert(0)dnl
; DONTE()

BRAC(FST(esyscmd([date '+[hello_%Y%m%d],'])))
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/hello.ini.m4" title="GitHub">hello.ini.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/hello.ini" title="GitHub">hello.ini</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 hello.ini.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; hello.ini</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="hello.ini">; DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!

[hello_20200115]
COMPLEX="!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~"
SUCCESS="Complex M4 code failed successfully."
NOFAULT="It's not a language fault!"</pre>
<h3 id="m4-h-hex-counter"><a href="#m4-h-hex-counter" title="⚓">A.7</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> .h – hex counter&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-h-hex-counter" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses the <code>COUNTER</code> macro to number the resulting <abbr title="C preprocessor">CPP</abbr> macros and one output queue.
The queue number <code>1</code> contains the preprocessor directive <code>#endif</code> to terminate the header file.
The decimal value of the counter is converted to the two-digit hex digit by keyword <code>eval()</code>.</p>
<pre title="messages.h.m4"># A → β
define([COUNTER], defn([COUNT_UP]))

# init counter
COUNTER(0)

# A → β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
[#define $1		0x]eval(COUNTER, 16, 2)
divert(-1)
])

divert(0)dnl
/*
 * DONTE()
 */

#ifndef __ERROR_H
#define __ERROR_H

divert(1)
#endif /* __ERROR_H */
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.h.m4" title="GitHub">messages.h.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.h" title="GitHub">messages.h</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 messages.h.m4 messages.mc &gt; messages.h</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="messages.h">/*
 * DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!
 */

#ifndef __ERROR_H
#define __ERROR_H

#define COMPLEX		0x00
#define SUCCESS		0x01
#define NOFAULT		0x02

#endif /* __ERROR_H */</pre>
<h3 id="m4-c-small-automaton"><a href="#m4-c-small-automaton" title="⚓">A.8</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> C – small automaton&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-c-small-automaton" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses a&nbsp;small automaton <code>NEW_LINE</code> to generate a&nbsp;newline <code>\n</code> character and one output queue number <code>1</code> containing <code>";</code> characters to terminate resulting string.
Run the first time <code>NEW_LINE</code>, is rewritten to <abbr title="epsilon – empty symbol"><code>ε</code></abbr>, in all following ones, it is rewritten to <code>\n</code>.</p>
<pre title="stringl.c.m4">#     NEW_LINE automaton
#      ___      ____
# ---&gt;/ ε \---&gt;/ \n \---.
#     \___/    \____/&lt;--'

# A → β
define([NEW_LINE], [define([$0], [\n])])

# A → β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)NEW_LINE[]$2[]dnl
divert(-1)
])

divert(0)dnl
/*
 * DONTE()
 */

char error[[]] =
"divert(1)";
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/stringl.c.m4" title="GitHub">stringl.c.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/stringl.c" title="GitHub">stringl.c</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 stringl.c.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; stringl.c</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="stringl.c">/*
 * DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!
 */

char error[] =
"!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~\nComplex M4 code failed successfully.\nIt's not a language fault!";</pre>
<h3 id="m4-c-small-automaton-2"><a href="#m4-c-small-automaton-2" title="⚓">A.9</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> C – small automaton 2&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-c-small-automaton-2" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>This example is similar to the previous one, but each string is on a&nbsp;new line.</p>
<pre title="string.c.m4">#      NEW_LINE automaton
#      ___      ________
# ---&gt;/ ε \---&gt;/ \n"LF" \---.
#     \___/    \________/&lt;--'

# A → β
define([NEW_LINE], [define([$0], [\n"
"])])

# A → β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)NEW_LINE[]$2[]dnl
divert(-1)
])

divert(0)dnl
/*
 * DONTE()
 */

char error[[]] =
"divert(1)";
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/string.c.m4" title="GitHub">string.c.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/string.c" title="GitHub">string.c</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 string.c.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; string.c</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="string.c">/*
 * DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!
 */

char error[] =
"!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~\n"
"Complex M4 code failed successfully.\n"
"It's not a language fault!";</pre>
<h3 id="m4-html-output-queues"><a href="#m4-html-output-queues" title="⚓">A.10</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> HTML – output queues&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-html-output-queues" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses two output queues.
The queue number <code>1</code> contains paragraphs.
The queue number <code>2</code> contains closing HTML tags.
Navigation links do not have to be stored anywhere, they go straight to the output.
The <code>QUERY</code> and <code>WARNING</code> messages are processed in the same way as the <code>ERROR</code> messages.</p>
<pre title="messages.html.m4"># vim:ft=m4

# A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
		[&lt;li&gt;$0: &lt;a href="#$1"&gt;$1&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;]
divert(1)dnl
	&lt;p id="[$1]"&gt;$2&lt;/p&gt;
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY], defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING], defn([ERROR]))

divert(0)dnl
&lt;!-- DONTE() --&gt;
&lt;!doctype html&gt;
&lt;html lang="en"&gt;
	&lt;meta charset="utf-8"&gt;
	&lt;title&gt;__file__&lt;/title&gt;
&lt;body&gt;
	&lt;h1&gt;The power of M4&lt;/h1&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
divert(1)dnl
	&lt;/ul&gt;
divert(2)dnl
&lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.html.m4" title="GitHub">messages.html.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/markup.m4" title="GitHub">markup.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.html" title="GitHub">messages.html</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 messages.html.m4 markup.m4 messages.mc &gt; messages.html</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="messages.html">&lt;!-- DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically! --&gt;
&lt;!doctype html&gt;
&lt;html lang="en"&gt;
	&lt;meta charset="utf-8"&gt;
	&lt;title&gt;messages.html.m4&lt;/title&gt;
&lt;body&gt;
	&lt;h1&gt;The power of M4&lt;/h1&gt;
	&lt;ul&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;ERROR: &lt;a href="#COMPLEX"&gt;COMPLEX&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;QUERY: &lt;a href="#READABLE"&gt;READABLE&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;ERROR: &lt;a href="#SUCCESS"&gt;SUCCESS&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;WARNING: &lt;a href="#ADDICTIVE"&gt;ADDICTIVE&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;ERROR: &lt;a href="#NOFAULT"&gt;NOFAULT&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
		&lt;li&gt;WARNING: &lt;a href="#NO_ERRORS"&gt;NO_ERRORS&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/li&gt;
	&lt;/ul&gt;
	&lt;p id="COMPLEX"&gt;!"#$%&amp;amp;'()*+,-./:;&amp;lt;=&amp;gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~&lt;/p&gt;
	&lt;p id="READABLE"&gt;Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?&lt;/p&gt;
	&lt;p id="SUCCESS"&gt;Complex M4 code failed successfully.&lt;/p&gt;
	&lt;p id="ADDICTIVE"&gt;Programming in M4 is addictive!&lt;/p&gt;
	&lt;p id="NOFAULT"&gt;It's not a language fault!&lt;/p&gt;
	&lt;p id="NO_ERRORS"&gt;No other errors detected.&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;</pre>
<h3 id="m4-branching-by-grammar"><a href="#m4-branching-by-grammar" title="⚓">A.11</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Branching by grammar&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-branching-by-grammar" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example shows <a href="#m4-nonterminals-for-branches">branching by grammar</a>, macro arguments are ignored.
Input nonterminals are rewritten to terminals <code title="&#x1f41b;">ERROR → &#x1f41b;</code>, <code title="&#x1f41c;">QUERY → &#x1f41c;</code>, <code title="&#x1f41d;">WARNING → &#x1f41d;</code>.</p>
<pre title="insect.txt.m4"># A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
$0_INSECT[]dnl
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY],   defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING], defn([ERROR]))
define([ERROR_INSECT],   [&#x1f41b;])
define([QUERY_INSECT],   [&#x1f41c;])
define([WARNING_INSECT], [&#x1f41d;])</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/insect.txt.m4" title="GitHub">insect.txt.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/insect.txt" title="GitHub">insect.txt</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 insect.txt.m4 messages.mc &gt; insect.txt</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="insect.txt">&#x1f41b;&#x1f41c;&#x1f41b;&#x1f41d;&#x1f41b;&#x1f41d;</pre>
<h3 id="m4-json-generating-automaton"><a href="#m4-json-generating-automaton" title="⚓">A.12</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – generating automaton&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-json-generating-automaton" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses two output queues and one generating automaton.
The first <code>ERROR([…])</code> error message in the <code>ERROR</code> state generates a&nbsp;header with brackets and outputs the first record.
The automaton goes to the state <code>NEXT_ITEM</code> which is a&nbsp;<abbr title="rule is used as the right side of another rewriting rule"><code>β</code> rule</abbr>.
The following error messages in the <code>NEXT_ITEM</code> state only output individual records.
At the end the output queue number <code>1</code> and number <code>2</code> print the characters <code>]</code> and <code>}}</code> to close the resulting JSON.</p>
<pre title="atm.json.m4">#      _______      ___________
# ---&gt;/ ERROR \---&gt;/ NEXT_ITEM \---.
#     \_______/    \___________/&lt;--'

# A → β
define([ERROR], [

	# transition to the next node
	define([$0], defn([NEXT_ITEM]))

	divert(0),
	"error": LB()
		{"[$1]": "$2"}dnl
divert(1)
	RB()
divert(-1)
])

# β
define([NEXT_ITEM], [

	divert(0),
		{"[$1]": "$2"}dnl
divert(-1)
])

divert(0)dnl
{"generating_automaton": {
	"_comment": "DONTE()"dnl
divert(2)dnl
}}
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/atm.json.m4" title="GitHub">atm.json.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/atm.json" title="GitHub">atm.json</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 atm.json.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; atm.json</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="atm.json">{"generating_automaton": {
	"_comment": "DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!",
	"error": [
		{"COMPLEX": "!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~"},
		{"SUCCESS": "Complex M4 code failed successfully."},
		{"NOFAULT": "It's not a language fault!"}
	]
}}</pre>
<h4 id="m4-json-named-queues"><a href="#m4-json-named-queues" title="⚓">A.12.1</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – named queues&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-json-named-queues" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h4>
<p>The example processes other types of messages <code>QUERY</code> and <code>WARNING</code>.
It uses three automata and six output queues.
If we generate more complex source code, we will soon encounter the problem of maintaining index consistency for output queues.
To avoid confusion, we use queue names instead of numbers.</p>
<p>To avoid having to define similar rules, we copy the right side of <code>ERROR</code> (it is also a&nbsp;<abbr title="rule is used as the right side of another rewriting rule"><code>β</code> rule</abbr>) to the right side of the <code>QUERY</code> and <code>WARNING</code> rules.
The <code>$0</code> variable is rewritten to the name of the macro and concatenated with another symbol.
The newly formed nonterminal is rewritten to the corresponding terminal symbol.
In this way branching is carried out.</p>
<pre id="m4-nonterminals-for-branches" title="grammar branching in M4">
$0_QU → ERROR_QU → 2
$0_END → ERROR_END → 3
$0_NAME → ERROR_NAME → error
$0_QU → QUERY_QU → 0
$0_END → QUERY_END → 1
$0_NAME → QUERY_NAME → query
…
</pre>
<pre title="qnames.json.m4"># DO NOT WRITE INDEXES MANUALLY, use counter!
define([QUERY_QU],     0)
define([QUERY_END],    1)
define([ERROR_QU],     2)
define([ERROR_END],    3)
define([WARNING_QU],   4)
define([WARNING_END],  5)
define([LAST_QUEUE],   6)

# names of message types
define([WARNING_NAME], [warning])
define([ERROR_NAME],   [error])
define([QUERY_NAME],   [query])

#      _________      ___________
# ---&gt;/  ERROR  \---&gt;/ NEXT_ITEM \---.
#     |  QUERY  |    \___________/&lt;--'
#     \_WARNING_/

# A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	# transition to the next node
	define([$0], defn([NEXT_ITEM]))

	divert($0_QU),
	"$0_NAME": LB()
		{"[$1]": "$2"}dnl
divert($0_END)
	RB()dnl
divert(-1)
])

# β
define([NEXT_ITEM], [

	divert($0_QU),
		{"[$1]": "$2"}dnl
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY],        defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING],      defn([ERROR]))

divert(0)dnl
{"queue_names": {
	"_comment": "DONTE()"dnl
divert(LAST_QUEUE)
}}
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/qnames.json.m4" title="GitHub">qnames.json.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/qnames.json" title="GitHub">qnames.json</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 qnames.json.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; qnames.json</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="qnames.json">{"queue_names": {
	"_comment": "DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!",
	"query": [
		{"READABLE": "Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?"}
	],
	"error": [
		{"COMPLEX": "!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~"},
		{"SUCCESS": "Complex M4 code failed successfully."},
		{"NOFAULT": "It's not a language fault!"}
	],
	"warning": [
		{"ADDICTIVE": "Programming in M4 is addictive!"},
		{"NO_ERRORS": "No other errors detected."}
	]
}}</pre>
<h4 id="m4-json-generated-queue-indexes"><a href="#m4-json-generated-queue-indexes" title="⚓">A.12.2</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – generated queue indexes&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-json-generated-queue-indexes" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h4>
<p>During development, the order and number of output queues often change, which also requires frequent changes of their indexes.
It is therefore appropriate to generate indexes.
We can then use a&nbsp;virtually unlimited number of queues.
The following example shows how these indexes are generated.</p>
<pre title="queues.m4"># defines a counter for output queues
# A → β
define([QUEUE_INDEX], defn([COUNT_UP]))

# initial index of the first output queue
QUEUE_INDEX(0)

# symbolic names for indices of output queues
# A → β
define([QUERY_QU],     QUEUE_INDEX)
define([QUERY_END],    QUEUE_INDEX)
define([ERROR_QU],     QUEUE_INDEX)
define([ERROR_END],    QUEUE_INDEX)
define([WARNING_QU],   QUEUE_INDEX)
define([WARNING_END],  QUEUE_INDEX)
# Keep it last!
define([LAST_QUEUE],   QUEUE_INDEX)

# names of message types
# A → β
define([WARNING_NAME], [warning])
define([ERROR_NAME],   [error])
define([QUERY_NAME],   [query])</pre>
<pre title="messages.json.m4">#      _________      ___________
# ---&gt;/  ERROR  \---&gt;/ NEXT_ITEM \---.
#     |  QUERY  |    \___________/&lt;--'
#     \_WARNING_/

# A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	# transition to the next node
	define([$0], defn([NEXT_ITEM]))

	divert($0_QU),
	"$0_NAME": LB()
		{"[$1]": "$2"}dnl
divert($0_END)
	RB()dnl
divert(-1)
])

# β
define([NEXT_ITEM], [

	divert($0_QU),
		{"[$1]": "$2"}dnl
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY],   defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING], defn([ERROR]))

divert(0)dnl
{"messages": {
	"_comment": "DONTE()"dnl
divert(LAST_QUEUE)
}}
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/queues.m4" title="GitHub">queues.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.json.m4" title="GitHub">messages.json.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.json" title="GitHub">messages.json</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 queues.m4 messages.json.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; messages.json</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="messages.json">{"messages": {
	"_comment": "DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!",
	"query": [
		{"READABLE": "Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?"}
	],
	"error": [
		{"COMPLEX": "!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~"},
		{"SUCCESS": "Complex M4 code failed successfully."},
		{"NOFAULT": "It's not a language fault!"}
	],
	"warning": [
		{"ADDICTIVE": "Programming in M4 is addictive!"},
		{"NO_ERRORS": "No other errors detected."}
	]
}}</pre>
<h3 id="m4-ini-discontinuous-queue-index"><a href="#m4-ini-discontinuous-queue-index" title="⚓">A.13</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> INI – discontinuous queue index&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-ini-discontinuous-queue-index" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses three automata and two output queues number <code>2</code> and <code>4</code> defined in a&nbsp;separate file.
INI section names are generated by symbol chaining.
The example uses the same file for output queues as the <a href="#m4-json-generated-queue-indexes" title="[] JSON – generated queue indexes">example</a> to generate JSON.</p>
<pre title="messages.ini.m4">#      _________      ___________
# ---&gt;/  ERROR  \---&gt;/ NEXT_ITEM \---.
#     |  QUERY  |    \___________/&lt;--'
#     \_WARNING_/

# A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	divert($0_QU)
BRAC($0_NAME)
[$1]="$2"
divert(-1)

	# transition to the next node
	define([$0], defn([NEXT_ITEM]))
])

# A → β
define([QUERY],   defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING], defn([ERROR]))

# β
define([NEXT_ITEM], [

	divert($0_QU)dnl
[$1]="$2"
divert(-1)
])

divert(0)dnl
; DONTE()
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.ini.m4" title="GitHub">messages.ini.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/queues.m4" title="GitHub">queues.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/code.m4" title="GitHub">code.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.ini" title="GitHub">messages.ini</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 messages.ini.m4 queues.m4 code.m4 messages.mc &gt; messages.ini</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="messages.ini">; DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!

[query]
READABLE="Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?"

[error]
COMPLEX="!\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_`{|}~"
SUCCESS="Complex M4 code failed successfully."
NOFAULT="It's not a language fault!"

[warning]
ADDICTIVE="Programming in M4 is addictive!"
NO_ERRORS="No other errors detected."</pre>
<h3 id="m4-xml-mixed-messages"><a href="#m4-xml-mixed-messages" title="⚓">A.14</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> XML – mixed messages&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-xml-mixed-messages" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example uses one output queue number <code>1</code> for the <code>&lt;/messages&gt;</code> closing tag.</p>
<pre title="mixed.xml.m4"># A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
	&lt;$0_NAME&gt;
		&lt;name&gt;[$1]&lt;/name&gt;
		&lt;value&gt;$2&lt;/value&gt;
	&lt;/$0_NAME&gt;
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY], defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING], defn([ERROR]))

divert(0)dnl
&lt;!-- DONTE() --&gt;
&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?&gt;
&lt;messages&gt;
divert(1)dnl
&lt;/messages&gt;
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/queues.m4" title="GitHub">queues.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/mixed.xml.m4" title="GitHub">mixed.xml.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/markup.m4" title="GitHub">markup.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/mixed.xml" title="GitHub">mixed.xml</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 queues.m4 mixed.xml.m4 markup.m4 messages.mc &gt; mixed.xml</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="mixed.xml">&lt;!-- DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically! --&gt;
&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?&gt;
&lt;messages&gt;
	&lt;error&gt;
		&lt;name&gt;COMPLEX&lt;/name&gt;
		&lt;value&gt;!"#$%&amp;amp;'()*+,-./:;&amp;lt;=&amp;gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~&lt;/value&gt;
	&lt;/error&gt;
	&lt;query&gt;
		&lt;name&gt;READABLE&lt;/name&gt;
		&lt;value&gt;Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?&lt;/value&gt;
	&lt;/query&gt;
	&lt;error&gt;
		&lt;name&gt;SUCCESS&lt;/name&gt;
		&lt;value&gt;Complex M4 code failed successfully.&lt;/value&gt;
	&lt;/error&gt;
	&lt;warning&gt;
		&lt;name&gt;ADDICTIVE&lt;/name&gt;
		&lt;value&gt;Programming in M4 is addictive!&lt;/value&gt;
	&lt;/warning&gt;
	&lt;error&gt;
		&lt;name&gt;NOFAULT&lt;/name&gt;
		&lt;value&gt;It's not a language fault!&lt;/value&gt;
	&lt;/error&gt;
	&lt;warning&gt;
		&lt;name&gt;NO_ERRORS&lt;/name&gt;
		&lt;value&gt;No other errors detected.&lt;/value&gt;
	&lt;/warning&gt;
&lt;/messages&gt;</pre>
<h3 id="m4-xml-separated-messages"><a href="#m4-xml-separated-messages" title="⚓">A.15</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> XML – separated messages&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-xml-separated-messages" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The example groups messages by their type using output queues.</p>
<pre title="messages.xml.m4"># A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	# transition to the next node
	define([$0], defn([NEXT_ITEM]))

	divert($0_QU)dnl
	&lt;$0_NAME&gt;
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;[$1]&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;$2&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
divert($0_END)dnl
	&lt;/$0_NAME&gt;
divert(-1)
])

# β
define([NEXT_ITEM], [

	divert($0_QU)dnl
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;[$1]&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;$2&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY],        defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING],      defn([ERROR]))

divert(0)dnl
&lt;!-- DONTE() --&gt;
&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?&gt;
&lt;messages&gt;
divert(LAST_QUEUE)dnl
&lt;/messages&gt;
divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/queues.m4" title="GitHub">queues.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.xml.m4" title="GitHub">messages.xml.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/markup.m4" title="GitHub">markup.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.xml" title="GitHub">messages.xml</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 queues.m4 messages.xml.m4 markup.m4 messages.mc &gt; messages.xml</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="messages.xml">&lt;!-- DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically! --&gt;
&lt;?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?&gt;
&lt;messages&gt;
	&lt;query&gt;
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;READABLE&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
	&lt;/query&gt;
	&lt;error&gt;
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;COMPLEX&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;!"#$%&amp;amp;'()*+,-./:;&amp;lt;=&amp;gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;SUCCESS&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;Complex M4 code failed successfully.&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;NOFAULT&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;It's not a language fault!&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
	&lt;/error&gt;
	&lt;warning&gt;
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;ADDICTIVE&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;Programming in M4 is addictive!&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
		&lt;item&gt;
			&lt;name&gt;NO_ERRORS&lt;/name&gt;
			&lt;value&gt;No other errors detected.&lt;/value&gt;
		&lt;/item&gt;
	&lt;/warning&gt;
&lt;/messages&gt;</pre>
<h3 id="m4-bash-cmd-echo-dstringd"><a href="#m4-bash-cmd-echo-dstringd" title="⚓">A.16</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash <code>~]$ echo "string"</code>&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-bash-cmd-echo-dstringd" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<pre title="doubleq.sh.m4"># A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
echo "$2"
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY], defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING], defn([ERROR]))

divert(0)dnl
#!/bin/bash
#
[#] DONTE()

divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/doubleq.sh.m4" title="GitHub">doubleq.sh.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/doubleq.m4" title="GitHub">doubleq.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/doubleq.sh" title="GitHub">doubleq.sh</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 doubleq.sh.m4 doubleq.m4 messages.mc &gt; doubleq.sh</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="doubleq.sh">#!/bin/bash
#
# DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!

echo ""\!"\"#$%&amp;'()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\\]^_\`{|}~"
echo "Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?"
echo "Complex M4 code failed successfully."
echo "Programming in M4 is addictive"\!""
echo "It's not a language fault"\!""
echo "No other errors detected."</pre>
<h3 id="m4-bash-cmd-echo-astringa"><a href="#m4-bash-cmd-echo-astringa" title="⚓">A.17</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash <code>~]$ echo 'string'</code>&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-bash-cmd-echo-astringa" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<pre title="apost.sh.m4"># A → β
# β
define([ERROR], [

	divert(0)dnl
echo '$2'
divert(-1)
])

# A → β
define([QUERY], defn([ERROR]))
define([WARNING], defn([ERROR]))

divert(0)dnl
#!/bin/bash
#
[#] DONTE()

divert(-1)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/apost.sh.m4" title="GitHub">apost.sh.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/apost.m4" title="GitHub">apost.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/messages.mc" title="GitHub">messages.mc</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/messages/apost.sh" title="GitHub">apost.sh</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 rootb.m4 apost.sh.m4 apost.m4 messages.mc &gt; apost.sh</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="apost.sh">#!/bin/bash
#
# DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!

echo '!"#$%&amp;'\''()*+,-./:;&lt;=&gt;?@[\]^_`{|}~'
echo 'Is badly written M4 code readable [N/y]?'
echo 'Complex M4 code failed successfully.'
echo 'Programming in M4 is addictive!'
echo 'It'\''s not a language fault!'
echo 'No other errors detected.'</pre>
<h2 id="m4-preprocessor-examples"><a href="#m4-preprocessor-examples" title="⚓">B</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;Preprocessor examples&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-preprocessor-examples" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h2>
<div class="rs-tip-major m4-tip">Chars. {<code>`'</code>, <code>[]</code>, <strong><code>␂␆</code></strong>, <code>〖〗</code>} in the name controls the <a href="#m4-nonterminal-expansion-control" title="Nonterminal expansion control">expansion of nonterminals</a>.</div>
<p id="m4-toc-ba-c-preprocessor-and-m4" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-ba-c-preprocessor-and-m4">B.1&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>`'</code> C&nbsp;preprocessor and M4</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-ba-css-comments" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-ba-css-comments">B.2&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>`'</code> CSS – comments</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-bash-nonprintable-characters" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-bash-nonprintable-characters">B.3&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong><code>␂␆</code></strong> Bash – nonprintable characters</a></p>
<h3 id="m4-ba-c-preprocessor-and-m4"><a href="#m4-ba-c-preprocessor-and-m4" title="⚓">B.1</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>`'</code> C&nbsp;preprocessor and M4&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-ba-c-preprocessor-and-m4" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_preprocessor" title="C preprocessor">CPP</a> directives are a&nbsp;one-line comment for M4, preventing unwanted expansion of the same named macros.
If we define a&nbsp;safer <code>SAF()</code> macro, the same named <code>SAF ()</code> macro will not be overwritten.
Thus, the <abbr title="C preprocessor">CPP</abbr> namespace <strong>can be</strong> completely separated from the M4 namespace.
The problematic character <code>`</code> is hidden in the <code>LQ()</code> macro.
Apostrophe <code>'</code> does not matter in the source code.
Apostrophe inside <code>ORD<del style="color:red"><span style="color:rgba(0,0,0,.75)">()</span></del></code> macro is hidden in <code>RQ()</code> macro.
Note the <code>define ()</code> or <code>ifelse ()</code> function names and where the <code>SYMBOL</code> is expanded.</p>
<pre title="file.c.m4"># ORDinary and SAFe macros have different expansion:

# A → β
define(`ORD', `$0_M4 RQ()SYMBOL`'RQ()')
define(`SAF', `ifelse(`$#', `0', ``$0'', `($1) * ($1)	/* $0_M4 SYMBOL */')')

divert(0)dnl</pre>
<pre title="file.c">/*
 * DONTE()
 */

#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;	/* CPP SYMBOL */

#define SYMBOL		/* CPP SYMBOL */
#define SAF(x)		((x) * ((x) - 1))	/* CPP SYMBOL */
#define ORD(x)		CPP SYMBOL x

int a = SAF (1 + 1);	/* CPP */
int b = SAF(2 + 2);	/* M4 */
char chr = 'x';
char foo[] = "Let's say: 'SYMBOL'";
char bar[] = "ORD (args, are, ignored)";

static void define (char *s) { puts(s);}
static void ifelse (char *s) { puts(s);}

int main(void)
{

#ifdef SYMBOL			/* SYMBOL */
	puts("LQ()SYMBOL'");	/* note: `LQ()SYMBOL' */
#endif

	define (foo);		/* SYMBOL */
	ifelse (bar);		/* SYMBOL() */

	return 0;
}</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootq.m4" title="GitHub">rootq.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/file.c.m4" title="GitHub">file.c.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/file.c" title="GitHub">file.c</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/preproc.file.c" title="GitHub">preproc.file.c</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 -DSYMBOL='Hello, world!' rootq.m4 file.c.m4 file.c &gt; preproc.file.c</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="preproc.file.c">/*
 * DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!
 */

#include &lt;stdio.h&gt;	/* CPP SYMBOL */

#define SYMBOL		/* CPP SYMBOL */
#define SAF(x)		((x) * ((x) - 1))	/* CPP SYMBOL */
#define ORD(x)		CPP SYMBOL x

int a = SAF (1 + 1);	/* CPP */
int b = (2 + 2) * (2 + 2)	/* SAF_M4 Hello, world! */;	/* M4 */
char chr = 'x';
char foo[] = "Let's say: 'Hello, world!'";
char bar[] = "ORD_M4 'Hello, world!' (args, are, ignored)";

static void define (char *s) { puts(s);}
static void ifelse (char *s) { puts(s);}

int main(void)
{

#ifdef SYMBOL			/* SYMBOL */
	puts("`Hello, world!'");	/* note: LQ()SYMBOL */
#endif

	define (foo);		/* Hello, world! */
	ifelse (bar);		/* Hello, world! */

	return 0;
}</pre>
<h3 id="m4-ba-css-comments"><a href="#m4-ba-css-comments" title="⚓">B.2</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>`'</code> CSS – comments&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-ba-css-comments" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>CSS uses the <code>#</code> character for color codes, which is also the beginning of a&nbsp;one-line M4 comment.
The <code>changecom(/*,*/)</code> keyword sets a&nbsp;multiline <code>/* … */</code> comment and rewrites into <abbr title="epsilon – empty symbol"><code>ε</code></abbr>.
The comments can be turned off with the same <code>changecom</code> keyword without parameters.</p>
<pre title="file.css.m4"># CSS preprocessor

define(`WIDTH', `3px')
define(`TOP', `#f00')
define(`SIDES', `#0f0')
define(`BOTTOM', `#00f')
define(`SITE', `www.root.cz')
define(`FILE', `img.jpg')
define(`PATH', `http://SITE/FILE')

divert(0)dnl</pre>
<pre title="file.css">/* DONTE() */changecom(/*,*/)
/* DONTE() */

div {
	border-width: WIDTH;
	border-color: TOP SIDES BOTTOM; 
	background-image: url('PATH');
}

/* DONTE() */
changecom/* DONTE() */changecom(/*,*/)</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootq.m4" title="GitHub">rootq.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/file.css.m4" title="GitHub">file.css.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/file.css" title="GitHub">file.css</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/preproc.file.css" title="GitHub">preproc.file.css</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 -DSYMBOL='Hello, world!' rootq.m4 file.css.m4 file.css &gt; preproc.file.css</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="preproc.file.css">/* DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically! */
/* DONTE() */

div {
	border-width: 3px;
	border-color: #f00 #0f0 #00f; 
	background-image: url('http://www.root.cz/img.jpg');
}

/* DONTE() */
/* DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically! */</pre>
<h3 id="m4-bash-nonprintable-characters"><a href="#m4-bash-nonprintable-characters" title="⚓">B.3</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong><code>␂␆</code></strong> Bash – nonprintable characters&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-bash-nonprintable-characters" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>Bash uses both characters <code>`</code> <code>[</code>.
If we do not want to hide them in an <code>LQ()</code> or <code>LB()</code> macro, we can use nonprintable characters for <a href="#m4-nonterminal-expansion-control" title="Nonterminal expansion control">expansion control</a> see example:</p>
<pre title="file.sh.m4"># vim:mps+=<strong>␂</strong>\:<strong>␆</strong>

# A → β
define(<strong>␂</strong>LEFT<strong>␆</strong>, <strong>␂</strong>$<strong>␂</strong>#<strong>␆</strong><strong>␆</strong>)
define(<strong>␂</strong>OP<strong>␆</strong>, <strong>␂</strong>-eq<strong>␆</strong>)
define(<strong>␂</strong>RIGHT<strong>␆</strong>, <strong>␂</strong>0<strong>␆</strong>)

divert(0)dnl</pre>
<pre title="file.sh">#!/bin/bash
#
<strong>␂</strong>#<strong>␆</strong> DONTE()

HELLO=`echo 'SYMBOL'`

if [[ LEFT OP RIGHT ]]
then
	echo $HELLO
fi</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootn.m4" title="GitHub">rootn.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/file.sh.m4" title="GitHub">file.sh.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/file.sh" title="GitHub">file.sh</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/preproc/preproc.file.sh" title="GitHub">preproc.file.sh</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 -DSYMBOL='Hello, world!' rootn.m4 file.sh.m4 file.sh &gt; preproc.file.sh</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="preproc.file.sh">#!/bin/bash
#
# DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!

HELLO=`echo 'Hello, world!'`

if [[ $# -eq 0 ]]
then
	echo $HELLO
fi</pre>
<h2 id="m4-m4-examples"><a href="#m4-m4-examples" title="⚓">C</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;M4 – examples&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-m4-examples" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h2>
<div class="rs-tip-major m4-tip">Chars. {<code>`'</code>, <code>[]</code>, <strong><code>␂␆</code></strong>, <code>〖〗</code>} in the name controls the <a href="#m4-nonterminal-expansion-control" title="Nonterminal expansion control">expansion of nonterminals</a>.</div>
<p id="m4-toc-json-left-bracket-b" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-json-left-bracket-b">C.1&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – left bracket <code>[</code></a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-bash-counters" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-bash-counters">C.2&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash – counters</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-h-brackets-h-dnl" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-h-brackets-h-dnl">C.3&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> .h – brackets <code>[]</code>, <code>[,]</code>, <code>[#]</code>, <code>[dnl]</code></a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-awk-examples-of-safer-macros" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-awk-examples-of-safer-macros">C.4&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> AWK – examples of safer macros</a></p>
<h3 id="m4-json-left-bracket-b"><a href="#m4-json-left-bracket-b" title="⚓">C.1</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> JSON – left bracket <code>[</code>&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-json-left-bracket-b" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The <code>[… nonterminals are not expanded …]</code> inside square brackets.
Therefore, the left square bracket <code>[</code> is replaced by the <code>LB()</code> macro defined in the root file.</p>
<pre title="json.m4"># JSON

divert(0)dnl
{"foo": {
	"_comment": "DONTE()",
	"bar": LB()
		{"baz": "SYMBOL"}
	]
}}</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/json.m4" title="GitHub">json.m4</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/hello_world.json" title="GitHub">hello_world.json</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 -DSYMBOL='Hello, world!' rootb.m4 json.m4 &gt; hello_world.json</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="hello_world.json">{"foo": {
	"_comment": "DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!",
	"bar": [
		{"baz": "Hello, world!"}
	]
}}</pre>
<h3 id="m4-bash-counters"><a href="#m4-bash-counters" title="⚓">C.2</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> Bash – counters&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-bash-counters" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The <code>COUNT_UP</code> and <code>COUNT_DOWN</code> counters are defined in the root file.
The <code>[… nonterminals inside brackets …]</code> will not be expanded, only the outer brackets will be removed.
The <code>LB()</code> macro defined in the root file must be used.</p>
<pre title="sh.m4"># A → β
define([LEFT], [$[#]])
define([OP], [-eq])
define([RIGHT], [0])

# define two counters
# A → β
define([__COUNTUP__], defn([COUNT_UP]))
define([__COUNTDN__], defn([COUNT_DOWN]))

# init counters
__COUNTUP__(10)
__COUNTDN__(10)

divert(0)dnl
#!/bin/bash
#
[#] DONTE()

if [ LEFT OP RIGHT ]
then
	echo '__COUNTUP__] SYMBOL LB()__COUNTDN__'
fi

if test LEFT OP RIGHT
then
	echo '__COUNTUP__] SYMBOL LB()__COUNTDN__'
fi

if LB()LB() LEFT OP RIGHT ]]
then
	echo '__COUNTUP__] SYMBOL LB()__COUNTDN__'
fi</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/sh.m4" title="GitHub">sh.m4</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/hello_world.sh" title="GitHub">hello_world.sh</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 -DSYMBOL='Hello, world!' rootb.m4 sh.m4 &gt; hello_world.sh</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="hello_world.sh">#!/bin/bash
#
# DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!

if  LEFT OP RIGHT 
then
	echo '10] Hello, world! [10'
fi

if test $# -eq 0
then
	echo '11] Hello, world! [9'
fi

if [[ $# -eq 0 ]]
then
	echo '12] Hello, world! [8'
fi</pre>
<h3 id="m4-h-brackets-h-dnl"><a href="#m4-h-brackets-h-dnl" title="⚓">C.3</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> .h – brackets <code>[]</code>, <code>[,]</code>, <code>[#]</code>, <code>[dnl]</code>&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-h-brackets-h-dnl" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The empty pair <code>[]</code> (or empty symbol in brackets <code>[ε]</code>) serves as a&nbsp;symbol separator.
Brackets around the comment character <code>[#]</code> turn off its original meaning as well as turn off the meaning of the <em>more powerful</em> M4 comment <code>[dnl]</code>.
They also turn off the original meaning of the comma <code>[,]</code> as a&nbsp;macro argument delimiter.
These symbols become ordinary terminal symbols without any side effect.</p>
<pre title="h.m4"># A → β
define([HELLO], [HELLO_WORLD])

divert(0)dnl
/*
 * [dnl] DONTE()
 */

[#]ifndef __[]HELLO[]_H
[#]define __[]HELLO[]_H

[#]define HELLO	SYMBOL

[#endif	/* __]HELLO[_H */]</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/h.m4" title="GitHub">h.m4</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/hello_world.h" title="GitHub">hello_world.h</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 -DSYMBOL='Hello, world!' rootb.m4 h.m4 &gt; hello_world.h</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="hello_world.h">/*
 * dnl DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!
 */

#ifndef __HELLO_WORLD_H
#define __HELLO_WORLD_H

#define HELLO_WORLD	Hello, world!

#endif	/* __HELLO_WORLD_H */</pre>
<h3 id="m4-awk-examples-of-safer-macros"><a href="#m4-awk-examples-of-safer-macros" title="⚓">C.4</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>[]</code> AWK – examples of safer macros&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-awk-examples-of-safer-macros" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<p>The universal alert <code>DONTE</code> is ignored without parentheses, like <code>LB</code>, <code>RB</code>, …
Such macros are explicitly created by a&nbsp;script developer, see the root file.</p>
<pre title="awk.m4"># AWK

divert(0)dnl
#!/bin/awk -f
#
[# DONTE()] ---&gt; "DONTE()"

BEGIN { print "DONTE[]() LB () LB() SYMBOL ]" }</pre>
<table class="table"><tbody><tr><th class="m4-inputs" title="input files"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/gfiles/rootb.m4" title="GitHub">rootb.m4</a><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/awk.m4" title="GitHub">awk.m4</a></th><th title="output file"><a href="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jkubin/m4root/master/hello_world/hello_world.awk" title="GitHub">hello_world.awk</a></th></tr></tbody></table>
<pre title="command">
~]$ <strong>m4 -DSYMBOL='Hello, world!' rootb.m4 awk.m4 &gt; hello_world.awk</strong>
</pre>
<pre title="hello_world.awk">#!/bin/awk -f
#
# DONTE() ---&gt; "DO NOT EDIT! This file is generated automatically!"

BEGIN { print "DONTE() LB () [ Hello, world! ]" }</pre>
<h2 id="m4-why-using-m4-and-why-not"><a href="#m4-why-using-m4-and-why-not" title="⚓">D</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;Why using M4 and why not?&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-why-using-m4-and-why-not" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h2>
<p id="m4-toc-why-generate-code-in-m4" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-why-generate-code-in-m4">D.1&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>&#x1f44d;</code> Why generate code in M4</a></p>
<p id="m4-toc-why-avoid-m4" class="m4-level2"><a href="#m4-why-avoid-m4">D.2&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>&#x1f44e;</code> Why avoid M4</a></p>
<h3 id="m4-why-generate-code-in-m4"><a href="#m4-why-generate-code-in-m4" title="⚓">D.1</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>&#x1f44d;</code> Why generate code in M4&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-why-generate-code-in-m4" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<ul>
<li>direct use of <a href="#m4-context-free-grammar" title="Context-free grammar">context-free grammar</a> (recursion for free)
<ul><li>a&nbsp;minimum M4 code is required for data transformation</li></ul></li>
<li>direct use of automata
<ul><li>possibility to model necessary algorithms (M4 does not need versions)</li></ul></li>
<li>direct use of stacks
<ul><li>stacks connected to automata extend the capabilities of the code generator</li></ul></li>
<li>direct use of output queues to temporarily store the resulting pieces of code
<ul><li>the individual queues are finally dumped to output in ascending order</li></ul></li>
<li>faster code generation (compared to XSLT)
<ul><li>low demands on computing resources</li></ul></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="m4-why-avoid-m4"><a href="#m4-why-avoid-m4" title="⚓">D.2</a>&nbsp;&nbsp;<code>&#x1f44e;</code> Why avoid M4&nbsp;<a href="#m4-toc-why-avoid-m4" title="Content" class="m4-toc">☰</a></h3>
<ul>
<li id="m4-low-level-language">low-level universal language (similar to C)
<ul>
<li>can not compete with narrowly specialized languages (for example XSLT)</li>
</ul></li>
<li id="m4-forgotten-language">non-existent developer community (Autumn 2019)
<ul><li>M4 is a&nbsp;forgotten language, small amount of existing projects</li></ul></li>
<li id="m4-unusual-language">an unusual programming paradigm requiring <a href="#m4-prerequisites-for-mastering-m4" title="Prerequisites for mastering M4">several prerequisites</a>
<ul><li>M4 is therefore a&nbsp;hard language</li></ul></li>
<li id="m4-experience-dependent">productivity greatly depends on experience (possible problem with deadlines)
<ul><li>the ability to think in M4 is an essential necessity</li></ul></li>
<li id="m4-hard-maintenance">maintaining a&nbsp;badly written M4 code is difficult
<ul><li>existing M4 code is easy to turn into confusion</li></ul></li>
</ul>
<!-- end of html generated by M4 -->
